snippet: About 16 percent of federal income taxes due have not been paid, and the enforcement mechanisms continue to be weakened, an economist writes.
abstract: About 16 percent of federal income taxes due have not been paid, and the enforcement mechanisms continue to be weakened, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of the coming book "The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform - Why We Need It and What It Will Take."
